newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: MALAYSIA STOCKS - factors to watch - June 13.
newsitem.headline: MALAYSIA STOCKS - factors to watch - June 13.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Malaysian stocks on Friday:
* The Dow Jones industrial average hit a fifth consecutive record, closing at 7,711.47 up 135.64 points on Thursday.

* The Kuala Lumpur Composite Index shed 7.84 points or 0.71 percent to 1,100.41 on weakness in key index component Telekom, which closed unchanged at 12.20 ringgit. It had dipped to a low of 11.40 ringgit.
* Central Bank Negara is due to hold a routine meeting with selected banks on Friday to discuss their foreign exchange activities, said banking sources on Thursday.
* Telekom Malaysia's acquisition of a 20.12 percent stake in Thai telecommunications firm Samart Corporation Plc earlier this week was not received well by analysts.

* Toiletries and cosmetics maker Zaitun Bhd will make its debut on the small-capitalised Second Board of the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange. The company is offering four million new shares priced at 2.10 ringgit each.
* "Yesterday's selling may continue today, pushing the (Composite) index further down. But volume will probably still remain low," said a dealer at a local bank-backed brokerage house.
"The record closes in New York do not seem to have helped our market recently," he added.
